member.name: T:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.ExcelConditionalFormattingCollection
member.summary: Collection of . This class is providing the API for EPPlus conditional formatting.

remarks.para: The public methods of this class (Add[...]ConditionalFormatting) will create a ConditionalFormatting/CfRule entry in the worksheet. When this Conditional Formatting has been created changes to the properties will affect the workbook immediately.
Each type of Conditional Formatting Rule has diferente set of properties.

member.name: M:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.ExcelConditionalFormattingCollection.ValidateAddress(OfficeOpenXml.ExcelAddress)
member.summary: Validates address - not empty (collisions are allowded)

member.name: M:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.ExcelConditionalFormattingCollection.GetNextPriority
member.summary: Get the next priority sequencial number

member.name: M:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.ExcelConditionalFormattingCollection.RemoveAll
member.summary:
Removes all 'cfRule' from the collection and from the XML.
This is the same as removing all the 'conditionalFormatting' nodes.

member.summary: Remove a Conditional Formatting Rule by its object

member.summary: Remove a Conditional Formatting Rule by its 0-based index

member.summary: Remove a Conditional Formatting Rule by its priority

member.summary: Get a rule by its priority

member.name: T:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.ExcelConditionalFormattingColorScaleValue
member.summary: 18.3.1.11 cfvo (Conditional Format Value Object) Describes the values of the interpolation points in a gradient scale.

member.param: The cfvo (18.3.1.11) node parent. Can be any of the following: colorScale (18.3.1.16); dataBar (18.3.1.28); iconSet (18.3.1.49)

member.name: M:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.ExcelConditionalFormattingColorScaleValue.GetNodeOrder
member.summary: Get the node order (1, 2 ou 3) according to the Position (Low, Middle and High) and the Rule Type (TwoColorScale ou ThreeColorScale).

member.name: M:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.ExcelConditionalFormattingColorScaleValue.CreateNodeByOrdem(OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingValueObjectNodeType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create the 'cfvo'/'color' nodes in the right order. They should appear like this: "cfvo" --> Low Value (value object) "cfvo" --> Middle Value (value object) "cfvo" --> High Value (value object) "color" --> Low Value (color) "color" --> Middle Value (color) "color" --> High Value (color)

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.ExcelConditionalFormattingColorScaleValue.Value
member.summary: The value of the conditional formatting

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.ExcelConditionalFormattingColorScaleValue.Formula
member.summary: The Formula of the Object Value (uses the same attribute as the Value)

member.summary: Enum for Conditional Format Type ST_CfType 18.18.12. With some changes.

member.summary: Highlights cells that are above the average for all values in the range.

member.summary: Highlights cells that are above or equal to the average for all values in the range.

member.summary: Highlights cells that are above the standard deviation for all values in the range. AboveAverage Excel CF Rule Type

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.BelowStdDev
member.summary: Highlights cells that are below the standard deviation for all values in the range.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.Bottom
member.summary: Highlights cells whose values fall in the bottom N bracket as specified.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.BottomPercent
member.summary: Highlights cells whose values fall in the bottom N percent as specified.

member.summary: Highlights cells whose values fall in the top N bracket as specified.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.TopPercent
member.summary: Highlights cells whose values fall in the top N percent as specified.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.Last7Days
member.summary: Highlights cells containing dates in the last 7 days.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.LastMonth
member.summary: Highlights cells containing dates in the last month.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.LastWeek
member.summary: Highlights cells containing dates in the last week.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.NextMonth
member.summary: Highlights cells containing dates in the next month.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.NextWeek
member.summary: Highlights cells containing dates in the next week.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.ThisMonth
member.summary: Highlights cells containing dates in this month.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.ThisWeek
member.summary: Highlights cells containing dates in this week.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.BeginsWith
member.summary: Highlights cells in the range that begin with the given text.
member.remarks: Equivalent to using the LEFT() sheet function and comparing values.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.Between
member.summary: Highlights cells in the range between the given two formulas.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.ContainsBlanks
member.summary: Highlights cells that are completely blank.
member.remarks: Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.ContainsErrors
member.remarks: Equivalent to using ISERROR() sheet function to determine if there is a formula error.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.ContainsText
member.summary: Highlights cells in the range that begin with the given text.
member.remarks: Equivalent to using the LEFT() sheet function and comparing values.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.EndsWith
member.summary: Highlights cells ending with the given text.
member.remarks: Equivalent to using the RIGHT() sheet function and comparing values.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.Equal
member.summary: Highlights cells equal to the given formula.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.Expression
member.summary: This rule contains a formula to evaluate. When the formula result is true, the cell is highlighted.

member.summary: Highlights cells outside the range in given two formulas.

member.summary: Highlights cells that does not contains the given formula.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.NotContainsBlanks
member.summary: Highlights cells that are not blank.
member.remarks: Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.NotContainsErrors
member.remarks: Equivalent to using ISERROR() sheet function to determine if there is a formula error.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ConditionalFormatting.eExcelConditionalFormattingRuleType.NotContainsText
member.summary: Highlights cells that do not contain the given text.
member.remarks: Equivalent to using the SEARCH() sheet function.

member.summary: The binary files created for text measurements of various font families just contains approximations of the characters where the carachters are divided into a number of width classes. This alone is not enough to get close enough to a good result. This class contains various scaling factors used to get the text measurements as close as the spreadsheet applications GUI as possible.

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.DataValidation.Contracts.IExcelDataValidationList.HideDropDown
member.summary: True if an in-cell dropdown should be hidden.
member.remarks: This property corresponds to the showDropDown attribute of a data validation in Office Open Xml. Strangely enough this attributes hides the in-cell dropdown if it is true and shows the dropdown if it is not present or false. We have checked this in both Ms Excel and Google sheets and it seems like this is how it is implemented in both applications. Hence why we have renamed this property to HideDropDown since that better corresponds to the functionality.

summary.para: Collection of . This class is providing the API for EPPlus data validation.

The public methods of this class (Add[...]Validation) will create a datavalidation entry in the worksheet. When this validation has been created changes to the properties will affect the workbook immediately.
Each type of validation has either a formula or a typed value/values, except for custom validation which has a formula only.

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.DataValidation.ExcelDataValidationList.HideDropDown
member.summary: True if an in-cell dropdown should be hidden.
member.remarks: This property corresponds to the showDropDown attribute of a data validation in Office Open Xml. Strangely enough this attributes hides the in-cell dropdown if it is true and shows the dropdown if it is not present or false. We have checked this in both Ms Excel and Google sheets and it seems like this is how it is implemented in both applications. Hence why we have renamed this property to HideDropDown since that better corresponds to the functionality.

member.name: T:OfficeOpenXml.Drawing.Chart.Style.eChartColorStyleMethod
member.summary: Method for how colors are picked from the Colors collection

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.Drawing.Chart.Style.eChartColorStyleMethod.Cycle
member.summary: The color picked from Colors is the index modulus the total set of colors in the list.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.Drawing.Chart.Style.eChartColorStyleMethod.WithinLinear
member.summary: The color picked from Colors is the first color with a brightness that varies from darker to lighter.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.Drawing.Chart.Style.eChartColorStyleMethod.AcrossLinear
member.summary: The color picked from Colors is the index modulus the total set of colors in the list. The brightness varies from lighter to darker

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.Drawing.Chart.Style.eChartColorStyleMethod.WithinLinearReversed
member.summary: The color picked from Colors is the first color with a brightness that varies from lighter to darker. The brightness varies from darker to lighter.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.Drawing.Chart.Style.eChartColorStyleMethod.AcrossLinearReversed
member.summary: The color picked from Colors is the index modulus the total set of colors in the list. The brightness varies from darkerlighter.

member.name: T:OfficeOpenXml.Drawing.Chart.Style.ePresetChartColors

member.name: T:OfficeOpenXml.Drawing.Chart.Style.ePresetChartStyle
member.summary: Maps to Excel's built-in chart styles, primary for charts with one data serie. Note that Excel changes chart type depending on many parameters, like number of series, axis type and more, so it will not always match the number in Excel. To be certain of getting the correct style use the chart style number of the style you want to apply For charts with more than one series use By default the styles are loaded into the StyleLibrary.You can also load your own with your own id's. Styles are fetched from the StyleLibrary by the id provided in this enum.

member.remarks: This method will not work if you run in an environment that does not support GDI. Cells containing formulas are ignored if no calculation is made. Wrapped and merged cells are also ignored.

member.name: M:OfficeOpenXml.ExcelRangeBase.AutoFitColumns(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the column width from the content of the range. Columns outside of the worksheets dimension are ignored.
member.remarks: This method will not work if you run in an environment that does not support GDI. Cells containing formulas are ignored if no calculation is made. Wrapped and merged cells are also ignored.

member.name: M:OfficeOpenXml.ExcelRangeBase.GetValue``1
member.summary: Convert cell value to desired type, including nullable structs. When converting blank string to nullable struct (e.g. ' ' to int?) null is returned. When attempted conversion fails exception is passed through.
member.remarks: If is string, parsing is performed for output types of DateTime and TimeSpan, which if fails throws . Another special case for output types of DateTime and TimeSpan is when input is double, in which case is used for conversion. This special case does not work through other types convertible to double (e.g. integer or string with number). In all other cases 'direct' conversion is performed.
member.exception: is string and its format is invalid for conversion (parsing fails)
is not string and direct conversion fails

member.name: M:OfficeOpenXml.ExcelRangeColumn.AutoFit
member.summary: Set the column width from the content of the range. Columns outside of the worksheets dimension are ignored. The minimum width is the value of the ExcelWorksheet.defaultColumnWidth property.
member.remarks: Cells containing formulas must be calculated before autofit is called. Wrapped and merged cells are also ignored.

member.name: M:OfficeOpenXml.ExcelRangeColumn.AutoFit(System.Double)
member.summary: Set the column width from the content of the range. Columns outside of the worksheets dimension are ignored.
member.remarks: This method will not work if you run in an environment that does not support GDI. Cells containing formulas are ignored if no calculation is made. Wrapped and merged cells are also ignored.

member.summary: Set the column width from the content of the range. Columns outside of the worksheets dimension are ignored.
member.remarks: This method will not work if you run in an environment that does not support GDI. Cells containing formulas are ignored if no calculation is made. Wrapped and merged cells are also ignored.

member.summary: Use the cells Text property with the applied culture. This only applies to columns with no format set in the Formats collection. If SkipLinesBeginning is larger than zero, headers will still be read from the first row in the range. If a TextQualifier is set, non numeric and date columns will be wrapped with the TextQualifier

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.ExcelWorkbook.Date1904
member.summary: The date systems used by Microsoft Excel can be based on one of two different dates. By default, a serial number of 1 in Microsoft Excel represents January 1, 1900. The default for the serial number 1 can be changed to represent January 2, 1904. This option was included in Microsoft Excel for Windows to make it compatible with Excel for the Macintosh, which defaults to January 2, 1904.

member.remarks:
To format the text you can use the following format
PrefixDescription
&UUnderlined
&EDouble Underline
&K:xxxxxxColor. ex &K:FF0000 for red
&"Font,Regular Bold Italic"Changes the font. Regular or Bold or Italic or Bold Italic can be used. ex &"Arial,Bold Italic"
&nnChange font size. nn is an integer. ex &24
&GPlaceholder for images. Images cannot be added by the library, but its possible to use in a template.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ePaneState.Frozen
member.summary: Panes are frozen, but were not split being frozen.In this state, when the panes are unfrozen again, a single pane results, with no split. In this state, the split bars are not adjustable.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ePaneState.FrozenSplit
member.summary: Frozen Split Panes are frozen and were split before being frozen. In this state, when the panes are unfrozen again, the split remains, but is adjustable.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ePaneState.Split
member.summary: Panes are split, but not frozen.In this state, the split bars are adjustable by the user.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ePanePosition.BottomLeft
member.summary: Bottom Left Pane. Used when worksheet view has both vertical and horizontal splits. Also used when the worksheet is horizontaly split only, specifying this is the bottom pane.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ePanePosition.BottomRight
member.summary: Bottom Right Pane. This property is only used when the worksheet has both vertical and horizontal splits.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ePanePosition.TopLeft
member.summary: Top Left Pane. Used when worksheet view has both vertical and horizontal splits. Also used when the worksheet is horizontaly split only, specifying this is the top pane.

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.ePanePosition.TopRight
member.summary: Top Right Pane Used when the worksheet view has both vertical and horizontal splits. Also used when the worksheet is verticaly split only, specifying this is the right pane.

member.summary: The active cell. Single cell address. This cell must be inside the selected range. If not, the selected range is set to the active cell address

member.summary: The Top-Left Cell visible. Single cell address. Empty string or null is the same as A1.

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.ExcelWorksheetView.SelectedRange
member.summary: Selected Cells in the worksheet. Used in combination with ActiveCell. If the active cell is not inside the selected range, the active cell will be set to the first cell in the selected range. If the selected range has multiple adresses, these are separated with space. If the active cell is not within the first address in this list, the attribute ActiveCellId must be set (not supported, so it must be set via the XML).

member.name: M:OfficeOpenXml.ExcelWorksheetView.SplitPanes(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Split the window at the supplied row/column. The split is performed using the current width/height of the visible rows and columns, so any changes to column width or row heights after the split will not effect the split position. To remove split call this method with zero as value of both paramerters or use
member.param: Splits the panes at the coordinate after this visible row. Zero mean no split on row level
Splits the panes at the coordinate after this visible column. Zero means no split on column level.

member.summary: Unlock all rows and columns to scroll freely

member.summary: Settings for usage of accessibility (aria, role) attributes of the table

member.summary: Use this property to set additional class names that will be set on the exported html-table.

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.Export.HtmlExport.HtmlExportSettings.DataValueAttributeName
member.summary: Use this property to set the name of the html data-* attribute that contains the raw value. Default value is "value" which means that the name of the attribute is "data-value". To change the name to "data-x", set this property to "x"

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.Export.HtmlExport.HtmlExportSettings.SetColumnWidth
member.summary: Set the column width for columns in the table via the columngroup/col element. Columns with the default width will have the default column width class set, ({Settings.StyleClassPrefix}dcw). Columns with custom column width will have the width set directly via the style attribute.

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.Export.HtmlExport.HtmlExportSettings.SetRowHeight
member.summary: Set the row height for rows in the table. Rows with the default height will have the default row height class set, ({Settings.StyleClassPrefix}drh). Rows with custom row height will have the height set directly via the style attribute.

member.summary: Set the target attribute for hyperlinks (a elements) in the exported html. Can be null/empty (no target attribute), _blank, _top, _self, _parent or a frame-name.

member.summary: If true data-* attributes will be rendered

member.summary: If picture drawings should be included in the html. Default is

member.summary: If the image should be added as absolut or relative in the css.

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.Export.HtmlExport.HtmlPictureSettings.AddMarginTop
member.summary: If the margin in pixels from the top corner should be used. If this property is set to true, the cells vertical alignment will be set to 'top', otherwise alignment will be set to middle.

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.Export.HtmlExport.HtmlPictureSettings.AddMarginLeft
member.summary: If the margin in pixels from the left corner should be used. If this property is set to true, the cells text alignment will be set to 'left', otherwise alignment will be set to center.

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.Export.HtmlExport.HtmlPictureSettings.KeepOriginalSize
member.summary: If set to true the original size of the image is used, otherwise the size in the workbook is used. Default is false.

member.summary: Adds the Picture name as Id for the img element in the HTML. Characters [A-Z][0-9]-_ are allowed. The first character allows [A-Z]_. Other characters will be replaced with an hyphen (-).

member.name: F:OfficeOpenXml.Filter.eDynamicFilterType.YearToDate

member.summary: If true filter is numeric otherwise it's textual. If this property is not set, the value is set from the first value in column of the filtered range

member.name: P:OfficeOpenXml.Filter.ExcelCustomFilterColumn.And
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the two criteria have an "and" relationship. true indicates "and", false indicates "or".
